CatDescriptText: Mr. John E. Jefferson, 837 Ashdale Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "Frankly, no. I don't think teen-agers should smoke or the parents allow them to do so.  When they become more mature, I think that it is all well and good."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John E. Jefferson wearing fedora, diagonally striped necktie, and light colored overcoat, standing across from corner store with sign that reads "We Alter Pants Free Landa..."
